Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Gigantic \Gi*gan"tic\, a. [L. gigas, -antis, giant. See {Giant}.] 1. Of extraordinary size; like a giant. [1913 Webster]
2. Such as a giant might use, make, or cause; immense; tremendous; extraordinarly; as, gigantic deeds; gigantic wickedness. --Milton. [1913 Webster]
When descends on the Atlantic The gigantic Strom wind of the equinox. --Longfellow. [1913 Webster]

gigantic adj : so exceedingly large or extensive as to suggest a giant or mammoth; "a gigantic redwood"; "gigantic disappointment"; "a mammoth ship"; "a mammoth multinational corporation" [syn: {mammoth}]
